Om Birla.description: NEW DELHI: The new Lok Sabha Speaker, Om Birla, a two-time BJP MP from Rajasthan, is a relative newcomer for the post traditionally held by seniors.   A surprise pick by the ruling BJP-led NDA   , Birla's name was proposed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi himself for the post, sources said. The 56-year-old leader is considered to be close to both Modi and Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) president Amit Shah. Birla's nomination for the Lok Sabha Speaker's post also has the   backing of non-NDA parties   such as the YSR Congress Party (YSRCP) and the Biju Janata Dal (BJD). Starting his political journey as a student leader, Birla was also elected to the Rajasthan Assembly for three consecutive terms in 2003, 2008 and 2013. He won his first Lok Sabha election in 2014 and was again elected this year from Rajasthan's Kota-Bundi seat. Birla defeated Congress's Ramnarayan Meena with a margin of over 2.5 lakh votes in the recently-concluded general election. A conscientious parliamentarian, Birla has registered an 86-per cent average attendance in the House, asked 671 questions, participated in 163 debates and introduced six private members' bills in the 16th Lok Sabha. From 1991 to 2003, he was a key leader in the Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) as a state-level president first and then, as a vice-president at the national level. Birla, who holds a Masters degree in commerce, is a member of the Standing Committee on Energy in Parliament, the Committee on Petitions and the Consultative Committee for the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment. He succeeds eight-time MP Sumitra Mahajan as the Lok Sabha Speaker, a post traditionally held by senior MPs. However, this is not the first time that a relative newcomer has occupied the position. In 1996, Telugu Desam Party (TDP) leader G M C Balayogi, also a two-time MP then, was elected as the Speaker in the Lower House of Parliament. After his death in a helicopter crash in 2002, Shiv Sena leader and first-time MP Manohar Joshi was appointed to the position. Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. AP Cabinet 2019: 25 ministers inducted i.description: * Swearing-in ceremony concludes * Peddireddy Ramachandra Reddy from Chittoor district sworn in as minister * K Narayana Swamy sworn in as minister * Buggana Rajendranath Reddy sworn in as minister * Gummanuru Jayaram sworn in as minister * Amjad Bhasha sworn in as minister * N Sankara Narayana sworn in as minister * Mekapati Gowtam Reddy sworn in as minister. * Anil Kumar Poluboina sworn in as minister. * Mekapati Gowtam Reddy sworn in as minister. * Mopidevi Venkata Ramana sworn in as minister. Ramana gets Cabinet berth even after losing in assembly elections. Ramana was a minister in YSR's cabinet too. He is also one of the accused in Jagan’s disproportionate assets case. * Balineni Srinivas Reddy from Ongole sworn in as minister. * Adimulapu Suresh sworn in as minister. He took oath in English * Perni Venkatramaiah aka Perni Nani sworn in as minister. * Vellampalli Srinivasarao sworn in as minister. * Mekatoti Sucharita, a scheduled caste MLA, sworn in as minister. She is also one of the early supporters of Jagan and came out from Congress party. * Kodali Sri Venkateswara Rao aka Kodali Nani sworn in as minister. * Alla Kali Krishna Srinivas aka Nani sworn in as minister. * Cherukuvada Sriranganatha Raju from West Godavari district sworn in as minister. * Taneti Vanita, MLA from Kovuru, a SC reserved constituency, takes oath as minister. * Muthamshetti Srinivas Rao aka Avanti Srinivas sworn in as Cabinet minister. Being an MP, Srinivas defected from TDP just before elections and won assembly polls from Bhimili constituency * Kurasala Kannababu, a scribe-turned-politician, inducted in Jagan’s Cabinet. * Pilli Subhash Chandra Bose takes oath. Bose is an MLC. He is one of the early supporters of Jagan in Congress party after demise of YS Rajasekhar Reddy. * Pinipe Viswaroop sworn in as minister * Alla Kali Krishna Srinivas aka Nani sworn in as minister * Botcha Satyanarayana from Vizianagaram district sworn in as Cabinet minister. * Pushpa Srivani, a tribal MLA from Kurupam constituency, sworn in as Cabinet minister. * Swearing-in ceremony started. Dharmna Krishnadas from Srikakulam is the first minister to take oath. * Andhra Pradesh CM Jaganmohan Reddy arrives at the swearing-in ceremony venue. Andhra Pradesh chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy is all set to induct 25 ministers in his Cabinet today. All of them have been asked to be present at Velagapudi secretariat for the swearing-in ceremony today. On Saturday, chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy assumed his office in the first block of AP secretariat at Velagapudi. The new cabinet consists of eight minsters from the Backward Classes, five from the Scheduled Caste community, four each from the Reddy and Kapu communities and one each from the Scheduled Tribe, Kamma, Kshatriya and Vysya community. The new cabinet will have five deputy CMs, each representing the SC, ST, BC, Kapu and minority communities. Those who made it to the new cabinet include Dharmana Krishna Das, Botsa Satyanarayana, Pamula Pushpa Srivani, Avanthi Srinivas, Kurasala Kannababu, Pinipe Viswaroop, Pilli Subhash Chandra Bose, Kodali Srivenkateswara Rao (Nani), Velampalli Srinivas, Balineni Sriniavs Reddy, Mekapati Gowtham Reddy, Buggana Rajendranath Reddy, Alla Kalikrishna Srinivas (Nani), Cherukuvada Srinanganadha Raju, Taneti Vanitha, Mekathoti Sucharitha, Alla Ramakrishna Reddy, Peddireddi Ramachandra Reddy, Gummanuru Jayaram, Narayanaswamy, Amzad Basha, Sankara Narayana and Anil Kumar Yadav. Jaganmohan Reddy has tried to avoid caste tags for his cabinet and has limited the representation of Reddy MLAs to just four seats. The party’s BC declaration is clearly visible in the composition of the new cabinet as the YSR Congress chief has given the highest number of seats in the cabinet to the BCs, which will also have one deputy chief minister from amongst them. YS Jaganmohan Reddy\u2019s first cabinet.description: VIJAYAWADA: The first cabinet meeting of chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy had rolled out several doles to the cross sections of the people. With focus on the farming sector, Jaganmohan Reddy’s cabinet tried to please all with some sops that he had been promising to the people and had included in the election manifesto. Besides giving nod to the increase of wages to the Asha workers and clearing the Rythu Bharosa scheme of paying Rs 12,500 to each farmer towards input cost, the new cabinet also increased the wages for the sanitation workers to Rs 18,000, Anganwadi workers to Rs 11,500, mid-day meal workers to Rs 3,000, creation of calamity fund with Rs 2,000 crore corpus and creation of market stabilisation fund with Rs 3,000 crore. The Cabinet had also set the dates to start implementation of every programme, thus trying to create an impression that this government stands by its word. The cabinet had rolled out several benefits to the farmer and the farm sector. Besides clearing the Rythu Bharosa, which is to be implemented from October 15 and benefit over 50 lakh farmers. This fund would be paid directly into the bank accounts of the farmers without the banks adjusting it against the loans of the farmers. The government would hold talks with the commercial banks on this count and if they refuse and insist on taking the money towards repayment of the loans, the government would pay this money through the Primary Agriculture Committees (PACs). The government would also extend interest-free loans to the farmers. This scheme will be rolled out in the name of late YS Rajasekhar Reddy. The government would pay the interest to the banks and send the receipt to the farmers through village volunteers. The cabinet had also cleared the proposal to buy 200 rigs to drill bore wells free of cost to the farmers. One rig each will be placed in every Assembly and Parliament constituency. AP Rythu Commission would also be formed with chief minister as chairman. The committee would have agriculture experts and representatives of the farmers’ associations and it would study the issues concerning the farmers and suggest remedies to the government. The poor would also get their 5 kilo rice every month delivered at their home by the village volunteers, which is now supplied through the fair price shops. The cabinet had decided to modernise 40,000 schools across the state providing basic and quality infrastructure. The cabinet had also given its nod to create AP Education Regulation Commission to ensure implementation of the Right to Education Act. It would insist on all private schools offering 25 per cent of its seats free to the poor. The Cabinet had decided to form a new sand policy avoiding influential people making money out of it and the government losing. The cabinet decided that every paise from sand mining should go to the government. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaganmohan Reddy's Iftar triggers contro.description: AMARAVATI: The Iftar party organised by Jaganmohan Reddy led Andhra Pradesh government snowballed into a major controversy after it was revealed that the cost of the event was Rs 1.8 crore. TDP supporters slammed the state government on social media platforms for spending this much amount on Iftar. "Jagan govt spent Rs 29 lakhs for the lunch of 15 thousand people who attended his swearing-in ceremony. But now why this Iftar party costs crores of money?" read one post. Supporters of Jagan strongly reacted to this on social media by saying that during TDP's rule, Rs 18 lakh was spent in three years on dry fruits for 4 Andhra officers, how can they criticise Jagan for the Iftar party expense? YSRCP General secretory Vijaya Sai Reddy also reacted strongly to the comments. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaganmohan Reddy to accompany PM Modi to.description: NEW DELHI: Andhra Pradesh chief minister Jaganmohan Reddy, who missed the swering in ceremony of Prime Minister Narendra Modi last week, will receive him in Tirupati on June 9 and will accompany him to the Tirumala temple. He has already met Modi after the recent elections before both of them had taken the oath of office and secrecy. Sources said Reddy is also slated to attend the NITI Aayog meeting to be chaired by Modi on June 15 in the national capital during which a number of issues related to social, education, health, and agriculture are likely to be discussed. This would be the first meeting after the formation of the Modi government at the Centre for the second time. Chief ministers of all states, Governors, Lieutenant-Governors, Union Ministers, and senior officials are slated to participate in the meeting. After his electoral victory, Reddy had also met BJP president Amit Shah and general secretary Ram Madhav in New Delhi. Reddy, who won 151 seats in the 175-member Assembly and 22 out of the 25 Lok Sabha seats in Andhra Pradesh, is said to have discussed providing outside or issue-based support to the Prime Minister Modi's government, in his meeting with him. Make foolproof arrangements for cabinet.description: AMARAVATI: Andhra Pradesh chief secretary LV Subramanyam has directed the officials to make foolproof arrangements for the cabinet expansion ceremony to be held on June 8. He said that the function would be held in the secretariat premises. The chief secretary reviewed the preparation of administration with the officials here on Thursday. He directed the officials to be careful in receiving the guests including the ministers-in waiting, their families and legislators. He asked the officials to create separate galleries for VIPs to prevent inconvenience. He instructed the officials to print the route map to the venue on the backside of the invitation for the ceremony. “Chief minister Jaganmohan Reddy is firm on not spending money on unneeded luxuries. The ceremony should be simple and also devoid of inconvenience,” the chief secretary said. He asked the police to take all measures to prevent traffic snarls on the roads that lead to secretariat. Subramanyam said that LED screens should also be set up in the rear end to enable all the guests watch the ceremony without any difficulty. DGP Gautham Sawang said elaborate security arrangements are being made for the ceremony. He said that additional forces would be deployed to oversee the security of the VIPs. GAD principal secretary (political) RP Sisodia said that they were expecting about 5,000 guests to attend the ceremony. He said that they are making all arrangements to conduct the cabinet expansion ceremony hassle free. Later, the chief minister also reviewed the arrangements for Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit to Tirupati on June 9. He directed the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams officials and Chittoor district administration to put all arrangements in place well before PM’s arrival to the temple city. HIGHLIGHTS Cabinet expansion schedule *Venue: Secretariat premises, Velagapudi. Muhurth: June 8, 11.49am *CM YS Jaganmohan Reddy to arrive at the venue at 11.44am *Governor ESL Narasimhan to reach the venue at 11.45am *Cabinet ministers’ swearing-in ceremony to begin at 11.49am *High-tea for the cabinet ministers, MLAs and officials after the swearing-in. All set for new govt\u2019s first assemb.description: AMARAVATI: The first session of the assembly after the formation of the new government will commence at 11.05 am on Wednesday. Pro-tem speaker Sambangi China Appalanaidu will administer oath to legislators on the first day. Chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy will be the first person to take oath after the commencement of the session. Opposition leader N Chandrababu Naidu will be allowed to take oath after the chief minister. Subsequently, pro-tem speaker will conduct the session till the completion of the oath by all the legislators. A notification for the election of speaker will be issued on June 13 and the election will be held on the same day. The chief minister has chosen senior legislator Tammineni Sitaram for the post of speaker. Sitaram will file his papers on Thursday and his election will only be a formality. Governor ESL Narasimhan will address the joint session of the assembly and council on June 14. There will be no session on June 15 and 16. The assembly and council will resume on June 17 and conclude on June 18. Not upset, says Roja; Jagan assures ‘suitable’ post in futureAfter meeting AP CM YS Jaganmohan Reddy on Tuesday, RK Roja said she was not upset over not becoming part of the cabinet. Sources said the CM has assured Roja a suitable post in future and explained the factors that kept her out of the cabinet. Later, Roja told the media that they fought elections only to make Jagan “anna” CM. “Once Jagan anna became the CM, we are all CMs. We are not expecting anything else,” she said, adding that the MLAs would serve the people better. Senior legislator Kakani Govardhan Reddy also met the CM. Jagan has spoken to senior legislators including Pinnelli Ramakrishna Reddy, Chevireddy Bhaskara Reddy, Nallapureddi Prasanna Kumar Reddy and assuaged their hurt feelings. Sources said senior leaders YV Subbareddy and Vijayasai Reddy were holding parleys with the disgruntled legislators. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Andhra assembly has a fresh look with 70.description: AMARAVATI: In what may be a record of sorts, as many as 70 first-time legislators walked into the assembly on Wednesday. This is the highest proportion of first-timers in the total strength of the assembly in recent history. Interestingly, as many as 67 of the 70 new legislators are from the YSRC, while only three were elected on a TDP ticket. This is nearly 45% of the actual strength of the YSRC in the assembly. Analysts are of the opinion that Y S Jaganmohan Reddy's experiment with new faces played a big role in the party sweeping the elections as people were tired of long-standing and veteran leaders fielded by the TDP. Many TDP veteran leaders, including six-time legislators Kodela Sivaprasada Rao and five-time MLA Dhulipalla Narendra Kumar lost the elections. The TDP had also been successful when it fielded new faces like Adireddi Bhavani (Rajahmundry Urban), Maddali Giridhar (Guntur West) and Ramaraju (Undi). Similarly, sitting legislator of Undi constituency Kalavapudi Siva, who had a clean image in the constituency, had lost when he was fielded from Narsapuram Lok Sabha constituency. Addanki legislator Gottipati Ravikumar has the rare distinction of being sworn in as YSRC MLA in the last assembly and a TDP MLA in the present assembly. He is the only legislator who won the election despite switching over to the TDP from the YSRC. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. KCR and Jagan Reddy settle building issu.description: HYDERABAD: In a significant development towards resolving one of the issues pending between both Telangana and Andhra Pradesh, governor ESL Narasimhan on Sunday issued orders allowing Telangana government to utilise AP government buildings in Greater Hyderabad, which is a joint capital for first 10 years after bifurcation. However, AP would be given a building to accommodate its police wing and another building for other AP government offices. With this, the Telangana government can take over J, K, L and H (South and North blocks) in the Secretariat complex, and over hundred various departments buildings under the control of AP government. During the formation of Telangana, as per Section 5 of AP Reorganisation Act, 201,4 and a GO (Ms No 196) issued by the united AP government, the governor had allocated A, B, C & D blocks in the Secretariat complex to Telangana secretariat and J, K, L and H (South) and H (North) to AP Secretariat from June, 2, 2014. KCR and Jagan rapport key to solving pending issueOn June 2, 2019, Telangana cabinet passed a resolution requesting the governor to hand over Secretariat buildings and other Heads of the Department (HOD) buildings under the control of AP. The buildings were sought by Telangana as AP government had shifted all its offices to its new capital Amaravati and the buildings were lying vacant. Some of the buildings are in dilapidated condition. A Raj Bhavan press release said: “Section 8 of AP Reorganisation Act, 2014, casts a special responsibility on the governor with respect to the issues of law and order, safety and security of citizens and vital installation as well as the management and allocation of government buildings in the common capital. By virtue of powers, I do hereby order that the contents of the resolution be put in place by initiating necessary measures.” As the AP government had been paying electricity bills and other maintenance costs for the buildings though it was not utilising them, the Telangana government also requested to waive all outstanding claims such as property tax and other public utility charges on AP government buildings in Hyderabad. Officials said this was the first long-pending issue that has been resolved as both the CMs, K Chandrasekhar Rao and YS Jagan Mohan Reddy, have a good rapport. The governor had discussed the issue with both the CMs when they had met him during Iftar party on Saturday. KCR again met the governor on Sunday and reportedly discussed the issue. “It is a welcome and auspicious sign that both the state governments have decided to move forward with people’s welfare in mind and development of both the states as the main aim with mutual goodwill,” KCR said. Six killed in Andhra Pradesh road accide.description: TIRUPATI: Six persons including two women died while four others were injured when their car rammed into a truck near Guravarajupalle, 20 km from here, on Friday, police said. While five people were killed on the spot, another died in the hospital, the police said, adding that the condition of two injured persons remains critical, they said. The mishap occurred at the crack of dawn when the vehicle with ten pilgrims from Rudravaram village of Achampet Mandal in Guntur district on their way to Tirumala, crashed into the stationary truck. Police suspect that the driver of the car might have dozed off behind the wheel resulting in the accident. The injured were admitted to SVRR Government hospital here, police said. Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Andhra's new government enhances social.description: AMARAVATI: The new government in Andhra Pradesh on Friday issued an order enhancing social security pension for the elderly, disabled, kidney patients and others. Under the 'YSR Pension Kanuka' scheme which replaced NTR Bharosa scheme of the previous Telugu Desam Party, monthly pension for the elderly, widows, weavers, toddy tappers, fishermen, single women, traditional cobblers and people living with HIV has been enhanced to Rs 2,250 from the current Rs 2,000. Immediately after taking oath as the chief minister on Thursday, YS Jagan Mohan Reddy had signed the file, enhancing monthly pension for the elderly with effect from June 1. He announced that the pension amount will be enhanced by Rs 250 every year to make it Rs 3,000 as promised by him during elections. Under an order issued by the Panchayat Raj and Rural Development Department on Friday, the age criteria for old age pensioners was also reduced from 65 years to 60 years According to the order, disabled persons will get a monthly pension of Rs 3,000. Under the previous scheme, people with 40 to 79 per cent degree of disability were paid Rs 2,000. Only those with above 80 per cent degree of disability were receiving Rs 3,000. For chronic kidney patients undergoing dialysis, the pension has been enhanced from current Rs 3,500 to Rs 10,000. Enhancement of pension amount and reduction in the age criteria for old age pension was part of 'Navarathnalu' or nine key welfare schemes promised by the YSR Congress Party. Meanwhile, Jagan Mohan Reddy on Friday said the massive public mandate had put on him a huge responsibility. Jagan, as the YSRCP chief is popularly known, said he would live up to people's expectations. "I thank God and each one of you for this unprecedented victory. This mandate has put upon me a huge responsibility. I will live up to your expectations," he tweeted I thank God and each one of you for this unprecedented victory. This mandate has put upon me a huge responsibility.… https://t.co/dyqjsV8miD— YS Jagan Mohan Reddy (@ysjagan) 1559286127000"I will bring upon good governance that will make the nation stand and look up to Andhra Pradesh," he added. The YSR Congress Party stormed to power last week with a landslide victory, bagging 151 seats in 175-member assembly. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

New districts formation soon: Deputy CM.description: AMARAVATI: Setting the ball of districts re-organisations on roll, deputy chief minister and revenue minister Pilli Subhashchandra Bose has said that the government is very keen to begin the process shortly. He said that the government is fully committed to fulfill the promise of chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy to create new districts with Lok Sabha constituency as head quarter. Bose assumed charge as minister in the secretariat on Wednesday. Speaking to media, Bose said that they have already directed the district collectors to send the basic data with regard to the creation of new districts. He said that they chief minister would take a call on the issue after going through the district collectors’ reports. Minister said that they would also start resurvey of lands in the state to bring all civil litigation to an end. He said that survey of lands is very crucial to avoid litigations and law and order issues. He said that lack of proper land records is leading to unrest among the farmers. He said that entire land survey would be digitalized to make all future transactions litigation free. Bose had also hinted at paying prevailing market rate to the oustees of land during the land acquisition. Finance minister Buggana Rajendranath Reddy said that priority would be given to the promises made in the manifesto in the preparation of budget. Reddy performed puja and assumed charge in his chambers in block-II of secretariat. He signed on the file to give the officials a go ahead to prepare the budget for 2019-20. Speaking to media, Reddy said that farmers, youth, women have all set high hopes on chief minister Jaganmohan Reddy and they would work to fulfill their aspirations. He said that they would take the cabinet decisions and promises in the manifesto into consideration in making allocations to different departments. “We will take full responsibility for spending of each and every rupee from the exchequer. We will take all measures to avoid unnecessary expenditure,” promised Reddy. Finance principal secretary SS Rawath, secretary Ravichandra and other senior officials were present. Social welfare minister Pinipe Viswaroop had signed on the file to set up new Ambedkar study centres in eight districts soon after taking charge in the secretariat. He said that TDP government had not spent even 10 percent of the budget allocated to the social welfare department. He promised to revamp the functioning of the social welfare hostels and studies in the residential schools. Housing minister Ch Sriranganatha Raju said that providing houses to all the shelter-less people in the state was top on the priority of his government. He said that they would go for land acquisition wherever there was shortage of land for construction of houses. Deputy chief minister and excise minister K Narayana Swamy had assumed charge in the IV block. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

YS Jaganmohan Reddy bats for SCS at NITI.description: VIJAYAWADA: Chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy made a strong case for the special category status (SCS) to the State at the 5th Governing Council meeting of the NITI Aayog in Delhi on Saturday. He spoke at length, giving documental evidence in support of the demand and requested Prime Minister Narendra Modi in particular and the country in general, as the chief ministers of all states were present at the meeting, to fulfil the promise given to the people of AP at the time of bifurcation. He also tried to impress upon the Prime Minister and others that giving SCS to AP is fulfilment of the constitutional obligation as it was promised in Parliament. It was also a political commitment, he said, as the BJP had included this promise in its 2014 election manifesto. The chief minister had built a strong case for SCS to the State by producing a copy of Union Cabinet decision on March 2, 2014 directing the Planning Commission to grant SCS to AP. He also produced a copy of the letter of 14th Finance Commission member, prof Abhijit Sen, who denied to have recommended the abolition of SCS. He tried to justify the SCS demand on the ground that except AP, no state in the country was bifurcated with a promise of giving SCS as a precondition, no state was bifurcated against the wishes of majority people and against the resolution of the State Assembly and the residuary state not having the capital. “The SCS has become the essential lifeline for my State. Such being the reality it is disheartening when we hear several rumours and excuses for not granting SCS,” the chief minister told the NITI Aayog meeting. While stating that the State inherited revenue deficit, lack of capital, absence of major industries, the chief minister said, “We need super speciality hospitals, five-star hotels, manufacturing industries, high-value service industries such as IT, premier institutions of higher education and research to transform the economic architecture of our State, which is possible only with SCS.” The chief minister further tried to draw the attention of the NITI Aayog saying that “employment generating potential has dropped so drastically that our children are leaving the State scouting for jobs.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Railways embarks on modernisation of sig.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Indian Railways has on Monday signed an MoU with RailTel Enterprises Limited (REL) for modernization of signaling system across a select railway lines including one in Andhra Pradesh. Initially, this system will be provided on 500 locomotives. The pilot project at an estimated cost of Rs 1,609 crores is to be completed in 24 months. The project will be implemented along 145 route kilometers (RKMs) on the railway line from Vizianagaram to Palasa in north coastal Andhra Pradesh falling under Vizag based Waltair division of the ECoR. Other routes include – a 165 route kilometers (RKMs) on Renigunta – Yerraguntla section on South Central Railway, 155 RKMs on Jhansi (JHS) – Bina (BINA) Section on North Central Railway and 175 RKMs on Nagpur (NGP) – Badnera (BD) Section on Central Railway. “These are some of the busiest routes on Indian Railway with heavy traffic. For Andhra Pradesh, the cost will be around Rs 300 crores of the total Rs 1,609 crores. The work will mostly begin in July,” a senior railway officer told TOI. The signaling system will be applied to four sections like automatic train protection system with long term evolution (LTE) based mobile train radio communication system (MTRC) together with provision of electronic interlocking (indoor) wherever required. The MTRC will improve safety, help reduce congestion in these rail networks and increase line capacity, improve punctuality. It will also help to increase average speed of trains. Talking about the project, Kashinath from the Railway Board, said “We need to implement modern train control system to keep pace with modern signalling and communication systems being used all around the world, to ensure safety of the passengers and increase line capacity to match with the challenges of running more trains on existing track.” Briefing about the project, Puneet Chawla, CMD/RailTel said “We are already on the job and team of REL has already taken inputs, feedback from industry representatives with respect to technology, interfaces, compatibility and interoperability of various sub-systems.” The MoU was signed by Pradeep M Sikdar, executive director, signal development, railway board, Ministry of railways and AK Sablania, director and chief executive officer of REL in the presence of N Kashinath from railway board and Puneet Chawla, CMD of RailTel. Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Jaganmohan Reddy keeps hopefuls guessing.description: AMARAVATI: With just a day to go for cabinet expansion, it's suspense time for YSR Congress lawmakers aspiring for cabinet berths in the new government. Party president and chief minister Jaganmohan Reddy have been keeping his cards close to his chest, and no one has any clue on who is making it into the cabinet and who is going to be left out. While some have been with Jagan for the past nine years and are therefore considered natural contenders, many senior leaders, who joined the party later or just before the elections, too are hoping to make it to the cabinet claiming their experience. Similarly, some young and fresh faces are also hoping for a berth under caste and regional equations. Jagan is likely to finalise the names and release the official list of cabinet ministers before the swearing-in ceremony, said a party insider. Unlike TDP chief and former CM N Chandrababu Naidu, who keeps the suspense till the last minute in the guise of holding negotiations with the probables, Jagan is expected to end the high drama by Friday evening. Meanwhile, chief secretary LV Subramanyam has directed officials to make foolproof arrangements for the cabinet expansion ceremony to be held on June 8. The function will be held in the premises of the secretariat. Subramanyam, while reviewing the preparations with officials on Thursday, directed them to be careful in receiving the guests, including the would-be ministers, their family members and other legislators. He asked officials to make separate galleries for VIPs to prevent any inconvenience, and print the route map to the venue on the backside of the invitation cards for the event. He also reviewed the arrangements for Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Tirupati on June 9. He directed TTD officials and Chittoor district administration to put all arrangements in place well before PM's arrival at the temple city. Some fresh faces are also hoping for a berth under caste and regional equations. Jagan is likely to release the official list of cabinet ministers before the swearing-in Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

CM Jaganmohan Reddy to hold review of re.description: VIJAYAWADA: Chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy will begin departmental reviews from June 1. Although he had initially planned to have a review of the finance department on the day in the light of the state government’s decision to stop all engineering works and payments from all departments till further orders, it was later decided to have the reviews in a row in the first week of June. The chief minister had posted the review of the finance and revenue departments on June 1 and giving a break on Sunday, the chief minister would review the departments of education and water resources on May 3. The review of agriculture and allied sectors and housing would be held on June 4, followed by review on AP Capital Region Development Authority on June 6. The reviews were aimed at getting basic but factual information from every department on its activities and the budgetary allocation by the previous government. In the review of the finance department, the chief minister had directed the chief secretary to get a note on the state’s financial position, the flow of funds from the central government and the external borrowings by the previous state government. The chief minister is understood to have expressed his displeasure over the government borrowing Rs 5,000 crore in the first week of April and Rs 1,000 crore in the second week, which was paid to women and farmers under the Pasupu-Kumkuma and Annadaata Sukheebhava schemes of the previous government. He wondered how the officials have gone for this borrowing without following the rules, as the amount was earmarked for first quarter of the financial year. “I am surprised to see the state ignoring the Fiscal Regulation and Budget Management (FRMB) Act rules in borrowing,” he reportedly commented when he was told about this borrowing. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

YS Jaganmohan Reddy announces 'Rytu Bhar.description: AMARAVATI: Scrapping the previous TDP government's "Annadata Sukhibhava" scheme which promised to provide Rs 10,000 to farmers, Andhra Pradesh chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy on Thursday announced a new scheme "Rytu Bharosa" under which the cultivators will be given Rs 12,500. Rytu Bharosa scheme was one of the major promises Reddy made during his poll campaign. The scheme will be implemented from October 15. In the review meeting with the agricultural department officials, Jagan said that steps should be taken to provide quality seeds, pesticides and insecticides to farmers. The chief minister also said that he will introduce Market Stabilization Fund of Rs 3,000 crores in the budget, which will be used by farmers to cover up any losses. Jagan further said that his government will take full responsibility of providing insurance to farmers. The government will pay the premiums, he informed. TDP supremo Chandrababu Naidu on vacatio.description: AMARAVATI: Telugu Desam Party (TDP) supremo and former chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had left for Europe tour on Wednesday. Naidu along with his wife Bhuvaneswari, legislator son Lokesh, son-in-law Brahmani and grandson Devansh took flight from Rajiv Gandhi International airport in Hyderabad. This is Naidu’s first holidaying overseas in the recent past. However, other details were not available on which nations Naidu is touring. Naidu will be back in the state on June 26. Although Chandrababu wanted to take the much-needed break after the poll debacle, he postponed the trip in view of the assembly session. He planned the week-long trip from Wednesday, immediately after the completion of assembly session on Tuesday. Ex-Andhra CM and Lokesh had, in fact, reached Hyderabad late on Tuesday night and took the flight to Europe on Wednesday. Naidu, who was rare to go on holiday in the past, was persuaded by son Lokesh to take a break from regular political activity and spend time with the family. The former Andhra chief minister visited Turkey along with family members in 2015. Interestingly, Naidu had considered his son’s request only for one year and skipped going on holidaying in the last three years citing hectic government and party business. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. In Video:BJP announces 28-year-old Tejasvi Surya for Bengaluru South seatDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Andhra Pradesh to become a model for oth.description: VIJAYAWADA: While addressing the joint session of the assembly and council on Friday, governor ESL Narasimhan blamed the previous government for its “inept handling of the challenges that emerged post bifurcation”. He also alleged that “misutilisation of resources” had resulted in an “empty treasury”. However, Narasimhan expressed confidence that the “state government can overcome the problems and ensure a satisfying public service delivery to the citizens.” While stating that “the new government has assumed office carrying hopes of five crore people”, the governor pointed out that the government has “a perfect blend of fresh and experienced” MLAs. Narasimhan pointed out that implementation of assurances made at the time of bifurcation should be at the top of the government’s agenda. “The government has a clear vision and actionable plans to deliver the promises made,” he said, adding that the system will be revamped and efforts would be made to make the state a model for the rest of the country. He further promised that the government “would place transparency and accountability on a high pedestal” and claimed the restoration of general consent to the CBI as its first move towards transparency in administration. He also lauded the initiative to form a judicial commission to look into tenders. Narasimhan pointed out that the government is “determined to take measures to prevent wastage of public money”. He mentioned the chief minister’s promise of creating village volunteers to ensure proper delivery of services to the people and the proposed call centre to monitor the system. He also spoke of the village secretariats. The governor pointed out that an integrated welfare agenda ‘Navaratnalu’ is being planned by the government which will include the YSR Rythu Bharosa, Arogyasri, Amma Vodi, fee reimbursement, YSR pensions, housing for all poor, YSR Asara, YSR Cheyutha and phase wise ban on liquor. “The government will focus on farmers’ welfare and is planning to set up a farmers’ commission. The government will provide Rs 12,500 per annum through YSR Rythu Bharosa to every farming household at the time of sowing from October 15, which would cost around Rs 10,000 crore to the exchequer. Besides, interest-free loans will be given out and free bore wells dug for farmers in addition to 9 hours power supply to farm sector during the day. Price stabilisation corpus fund with Rs 3,000 crore and calamity relief fund of Rs 2,000 crore will also be provided,” the governor said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jaganmohan Reddy to.description: AMARAVATI: Andhra Pradesh chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy has decided to appoint five deputy chief ministers, one each from SC, ST, BC, minority and Kapu communities. Reddy announced his plans at legislature party meeting held here on Friday. This will be the first time for any Cabinet to have five deputy CMs in the country. Two deputy CMs, one each from BC and Kapu communities, served under Chandrababu Naidu in the past. All the newly-elected MLAs attended the session held at CM’s camp office in Tadepalle. Addressing the legislature party meeting, Jagan said that he would be taking new ministers keeping in view of the people's aspirations. He said that a 25-member Cabinet would be sworn in on Saturday. YS Jagan reverses Chandrababu Naidu govt order, allows CBI to conduct probe in Andhra PradeshThe CM said that he would go for reshuffling of Cabinet after two-and-half years. He asked party legislators to be careful in handling the people's grievances as people are closely watching their performance. He said that they should show the difference between YSRCP government and the previous government. In Video:AP CM Jaganmohan Reddy to have five deputy CMs in cabinetDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Andhra Pradesh: After decade-long associ.description: AMARAVATI: Dr Mukthapuram Harikrishna, native of Pulivendula in Kadapa district, is a pediatrician by profession. He did his graduation in medicine from the prestigious Kurnool Medical College (KMC) and post-graduation in pediatrics from Osmania Medical College. He took a surprise decision to quit his practice to extend his support to the YS family following the sudden death of then chief minister YS Rajasekhara Reddy. He remained with the YS family without setting any political goals. A decade long association with YS family particularly YS Jagan, has now landed him in the chief minister’s office. Harikrishna has been appointed as special officer to chief minister Jaganmohan to assist him in public grievances. Interestingly, Harikrishna is the only leader who accompanied both Sharmila and Jagan during their long padayatras in the state. He walked along YS Sharmila for about 3112km and another 3648km with YS Jagan. Although, Harikrishna served as state president of AP Junior Doctors Association (APJUDA) during his student days, he never sought any political favours from Jagan to contest the direct elections. He remained a loyalist to Jagan and wanted to serve the public through his office. “CM decided to keep Harikrishna in his office as he wanted to serve people with human touch. Appointment of a pediatrician in CMO is a rare one,” said a senior official. Sources said that Harikrishna used to closely coordinate the health needs of the public who approached Jagan during padayatra. Although, a medical professional, Dr Harikrishna simply worked like a personal assistant to Jagan by sorting out the representations received from the public. “Having such an official in CMO would surely help the commoners as he is going to be eyes and ears of chief minister in handling the public health issues,” said a senior YSRCP leader. BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

CM Jaganmohan Reddy may keep controversi.description: AMARAVATI: The YSRCP’s vocal faces such as Ambati Rambabu and RK Roja are most unlikely to make it to the Jagan’s cabinet as the chief minister is said to be mulling to induct only non-controversial leaders in the elite team. Although, Jagan is believed to be sympathetic towards these senior leaders, he is of the view that the job in the cabinet is an altogether a different one. Jagan is reportedly unwilling to take any chances by keeping outspoken MLAs in his cabinet. Sources said that Jagan might consider giving the berth to leaders like Ambati and Roja only as last option when all the equations and calculations of caste, region, gender and district are in their favour. Ambati Rambabu, who defeated assembly Speaker of Naidu’s term, Dr Kodela Sivaprasada Rao in Sattenapalle constituency, is in fact the one among the first batch of leaders who quit Congress party about nine years ago and stayed firm with Jagan. He was the YSRCP’s chief spokesperson for several years. An articulate orator, Ambati is a two-time legislator and staunch follower of late chief minister YS Rajasekhara Reddy. Analysts believe that Ambati, who hails from kapu community, should have been the automatic choice to be in the cabinet from the community quota. Although, at least 3-4 kapus would find berths in the cabinet of Jagan when it is fully expanded to the maximum strength of 26 (including CM), it is believed that Ambati might find it very difficult to get a chance. Sources said that senior kapu leader and MLC Ummareddi Venkateswarlu might be in the contention for the cabinet berth from Guntur district quota. While Mangalagiri legislator, Alla Ramakrishna Reddy, who defeated Chandrababu Naidu’s son Lokesh in Mangalagiri, is expected to be the first choice, Guntur East legislator Mohammed Mustafa is likely to get the chance in minority quota. Although, Amjad Basha of Kadapa is in the race for the berth from minority quota, sources said that Kadapa district might not get any additional berths except CM due to the intense pressures from senior legislators Gadikota Srikanth Reddy, Korumutla Srinivasulu. Sources said that senior leader Peddireddi Ramachandra Reddy might be the lone face from Chittoor to be in the cabinet. Nagari MLA Roja (Reddy) is facing stiff competition from Jagan’s die-hard loyalist Reddy legislators, Bhumana Karunakar Reddy and Chevireddy Bhaskara Reddy. “Roja might get the chance only when CM does not find suitable leaders from woman quota,” said an insider. Roja is also one of the few fierce orators in the party and had faced humiliation including a year-long suspension from the assembly during TDP government. YSRCP sympathisers wanted Jagan to reward Roja with cabinet place for her loyal and spirited fighting against the TDP government. HIGHLIGHTS * Speculation is rife that Jagan might handover the key home ministry to a dalit legislator to show his commitment to the dalit empowerment * Names of Pinipe Viswaroop (Amalapuram), Talari Venkata Rao (Gopalapuram) and Adimulam Suresh (Yerragondapalem) are in the consideration to handle home ministry. * At least 50 percent of the berths to be given to BC, SC, ST and minorities in the full cabinet. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Doctors' strike hit healthcare services.description: HYDERABAD/AMARAVATI: The nationwide strike called by the Indian Medical Association (IMA) to protest the attack on doctors in West Bengal affected medical services in government and private hospitals in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh. The out-patient services at major government hospitals like Osmania General Hospital, Gandhi Hospital and Nizam's Institute of Medical Sciences (NIMS) in Hyderabad came to a standstill. Hundreds of patients who came to these hospitals from various parts of the state had to face hardships as doctors stayed away from their duties and participated in protests condemning attacks on their colleagues in West Bengal. Doctors boycotted all services except emergency at the government and corporate hospitals and nursing homes. Doctors at Osmania Hospital staged a protest, demanding punishment to those involved in the attack. They were carrying placards with slogans like 'no security no service' and 'suffering but still serving'. At the protest held at Gandhi Hospital, the doctors demanded stringent law to deal with the attacks on their fraternity. Out-patient services also came to a halt at government and private hospitals in the rest of Telangana. Patients suffered in Andhra Pradesh as doctors struck work in response to the shutdown call by the IMA. Doctors at hospitals in Vijayawada, Guntur, Visakhapatnam, Tirupati, Kurnool and other places boycotted their duties and staged protests. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Jagan-Modi bonhomie a sign of closer tie.description: AMARAVATI: In what could be called a smart move of getting closer to the BJP leadership, YSRC chief and chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy accompanied Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his Tirumala visit on Sunday. In signs of growing bonhomie between the two parties, Jagan extended full protocol courtesy to the PM on his visit to the temple town and received Modi, even though the PM was scheduled to address a public meeting, organized by the state BJP leadership, before his darshan. Though the YSRC was neither an ally of BJP in the elections nor part of NDA, Jagan is not losing any opportunity to come closer to the BJP leadership and secure sops to tackle a debt-hit state and empty coffers. He has already said before that he requires strong support from the Centre to tackle the empty coffers of the state. As CM, Jagan is keen on achieving big-ticket projects along with special category status with the support of Modi and BJP leadership to push his political rival N Chandrababu Naidu into a corner. Naidu’s drubbing in the elections has made Jagan a new sensation on the national political stage, and a favourite among the BJP leadership as Naidu over-jealously worked with an agenda of dethroning Modi. Speculation is rife that Jagan might even consider joining the NDA after getting one or two sops cleared by the Centre. By decimating the BJP’s rivals in the state —TDP and Congress — Jagan seems to have won the hearts of BJP and is now eagerly waiting for the Centre to reciprocate. BJP, too, is not averse to hug Jagan as it might utilise YSRC’s strength in the Lok Sabha as a cushion to off-load the pressures from its allies, like Shiv Sena and JD-U, which have already started flexing their muscles. Since YSRC emerged as the fourth-largest party in the Lok Sabha with 22 MPs, BJP might not hesitate to forge an alliance with it, if at all such an opportunity comes to its table. Such an alliance will make BJP more formidable in the southern plateau. In fact, Jagan rushed to New Delhi and met Modi immediately after winning the elections in the state. He held lengthy discussions with the PM and BJP chief Amit Shah, before taking over the reins of the state. Interestingly, Modi, while congratulating Jagan from a party-sponsored public meeting, assured to extend full support to his government in the state. Devotees at receiving end of VIP visitsHeavy security imposed in view of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit to Tirupati left devotees stranded in Tirumala on Sunday. The temple city, which has been reeling under the impact of the heavy influx of pilgrims, saw a near-shutdown that restricted pilgrim movements for almost six hours. Though the PM arrived at Tirupati Airport at around 5:30 pm, Tirumala police and the TTD’s vigilance and security wing sealed off entry and exit points at important congregation points as early as 3 pm, leaving pilgrims uncertain about exit routes. With barricades in and around the temple closed, pilgrims had great difficulty moving around Tirumala on Friday evening. Meanwhile, AP governor ESL Narasimhan, DGP D Gautam Sawang and National Human Rights Commission chairman HL Dattu offered prayers to Lord Venkateswara at the Tirumala temple on Sunday morning.
